comments.raw_text:
When you have a series of elements like so:

<vbox>
  <vbox>
    <hbox style="overflow-x: hidden; min-height: 50px;">...</hbox>
  </vbox>
  <hbox>...</hbox>
</vbox>

The second hbox overlaps the first. It seems the first hbox's borders are drawn to the correct size, but the second hbox is positioned as though there was no min-height on the first.

Attached is a test case (in HTML, but using XUL box layout) that shows the bug in action. I'm leaving this unconfirmed, since I'm not 100% sure this is a bug, but it's certainly not what I'd expect.

This is troublesome for Thunderbird in particular, since our toolbars are laid out this way, and they have overflow-x: hidden; set on them so that they don't push the rest of the chrome out of the window. However, removing all the elements from a toolbar causes the rest of the chrome to get shifted up, even though it shouldn't because of the min-height.
comments.author: jporterbugs@gmail.com
